metadata.Title: CVE-2015-7744 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
wolfSSL (formerly CyaSSL) before 3.6.8 does not properly handle faultsassociated with the Chinese Remainder Theorem (CRT) process when allowingephemeral key exchange without low memory optimizations on a server, whichmakes it easier for remote attackers to obtain private RSA keys bycapturing TLS handshakes, aka a Lenstra attack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7744` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

mariadb-client - 10.0.22-0ubuntu1
mariadb-client-10.0 - 10.0.22-0ubuntu1
mariadb-client-core-10.0 - 10.0.22-0ubuntu1
mariadb-common - 10.0.22-0ubuntu1
mariadb-connect-engine-10.0 - 10.0.22-0ubuntu1
mariadb-oqgraph-engine-10.0 - 10.0.22-0ubuntu1
mariadb-server - 10.0.22-0ubuntu1
mariadb-server-10.0 - 10.0.22-0ubuntu1
mariadb-server-core-10.0 - 10.0.22-0ubuntu1
mariadb-test - 10.0.22-0ubuntu1
mariadb-test-10.0 - 10.0.22-0ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

percona-xtradb-cluster-server - 5.6.34-26.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
percona-xtradb-cluster-server-5.6 - 5.6.34-26.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
percona-xtradb-cluster-source-5.6 - 5.6.34-26.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: mariadb-10.0 package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.0.22-0ubuntu1').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.6 package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.6.34-26.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
percona-server-5.6 package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and needs fixing.
